00020 #include <stdio.h>
00021 #include <stdlib.h>
00022 #include <errno.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <sqlite3.h>
00025 #include "libphonefirewall.h"
00026 
00027 int evaluate_stmt(sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt,
00028                   struct Entry *p_entry)
00029 {
00030         int num_column;
00031         int count;
00032         char *col_name;
00033         char *col_value;
00034         int tmp_priority = 0;
00035         int tmp_country_code = 0;
00036         int tmp_area_code = 0;
00037         unsigned long long tmp_number = 0;
00038 
00039         num_column = sqlite3_column_count(pp_stmt);
00040         col_name = sqlite3_malloc(2 * num_column * sizeof(const char *) + 1);
00041 
00042         for ( count = 0; count < num_column; count++ ) {
00043                 col_name = (char *)sqlite3_column_name(pp_stmt, count);
00044                 col_value = (char *)sqlite3_column_text(pp_stmt, count);
00045                 if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_PRIORITY) ) {
00046                         tmp_priority = atoi(col_value);
00047                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE) ) {
00048                         tmp_country_code = atoi(col_value);
00049                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_AREACODE) ) {
00050                         tmp_area_code = atoi(col_value);
00051                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_NUMBER) ) {
00052                         tmp_number = atoll(col_value);
00053                 }
00054         }
00055 
00056         if ( PRIO_ALL == tmp_priority ) {
00057                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00058                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00059                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00060                         return 1;
00061                 }
00062         } else if ( tmp_priority <= (p_entry->priority) ) {
00063                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00064                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00065                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00066                         return 1;
00067                 }
00068         }
00069 
00070         return 0;
00071 }
00072 
00073 int evaluate_stmt_string(sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt,
00074                          char *number,
00075                          int priority)
00076 {
00077         int num_column;
00078         int count;
00079         char *col_name;
00080         char *col_value;
00081         int tmp_priority = 0;
00082         char tmp_number[32] = "";
00083 
00084         num_column = sqlite3_column_count(pp_stmt);
00085         col_name = sqlite3_malloc(2 * num_column * sizeof(const char *) + 1);
00086 
00087         for ( count = 0; count < num_column; count++ ) {
00088                  col_name = (char *)sqlite3_column_name(pp_stmt, count);
00089                  col_value = (char *)sqlite3_column_text(pp_stmt, count);
00090                  if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_PRIORITY) ) {
00091                          tmp_priority = atoi(col_value);
00092                  } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE) ) {
00093                          strcat(tmp_number, col_value);
00094                  } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_AREACODE) ) {
00095                          strcat(tmp_number, col_value);
00096                  } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_NUMBER) ) {
00097                          strcat(tmp_number, col_value);
00098                  }
00099         }
00100 
00101         if ( PRIO_ALL == tmp_priority ) {
00102                 if ( 0 == strcmp(tmp_number, number) ) return 1;
00103         } else if ( tmp_priority <= priority ) {
00104                 if ( 0 == strcmp(tmp_number, number) ) return 1;
00105         }
00106 
00107         return 0;
00108 }
00109 
00110 int add_entry(int country_code,
00111               int area_code,
00112               unsigned long long number,
00113               char *name,
00114               char *reason,
00115               int priority,
00116               int listflag)
00117 {
00118         if ( priority < PRIO_ALL
00119                         || 0 == country_code
00120                         || 0 == area_code
00121                         || 0 == number ) return -1;
00122 
00123         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00124 
00125         sqlite3 *db;
00126         char *errMsg = 0;
00127         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00128         int rc;
00129         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00130 
00131         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00132 
00133         if ( rc ) {
00134                 sprintf(error, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00135                 ERR_LOG(error);
00136                 sqlite3_close(db);
00137                 return -1;
00138         }
00139 
00140         sprintf(stmt, "INSERT INTO %s (%s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s) VALUES(%d, %d, %d, %lld, \"%s\", \"%s\")", listname, TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, TB_NAME, TB_REASON, priority, country_code, area_code, number, name, reason);
00141 
00142         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00143         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00144                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00145                 ERR_LOG(error);
00146                 sqlite3_close(db);
00147                 return -1;
00148         }
00149 
00150         sqlite3_close(db);
00151 
00152         return 0;
00153 }

00155 int rm_entry (int country_code,
00156               int area_code,
00157               unsigned long long number,
00158               int listflag)
00159 {
00160         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00161 
00162         sqlite3 *db;
00163         char *errMsg = 0;
00164         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00165         int rc;
00166         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00167 
00168         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00169 
00170         if ( rc ) {
00171                 sprintf(error, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00172                 ERR_LOG(error);
00173                 sqlite3_close(db);
00174                 return -1;
00175         }
00176 
00177         sprintf(stmt, "DELETE FROM %s WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00178 
00179         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00180         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00181                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00182                 ERR_LOG(error);
00183                 sqlite3_close(db);
00184                 return -1;
00185         }
00186 
00187         sqlite3_close(db);
00188         return 0;
00189 }
00190 
00191 int check_entry(int country_code,
00192                 int area_code,
00193                 unsigned long long number,
00194                 int priority,
00195                 int listflag)
00196 {
00197         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00198 
00199         sqlite3 *db;
00200         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00201         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00202         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00203         int rc;
00204         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00205         int found_flag = 0;
00206 
00207         struct Entry *p_entry = (struct Entry *) malloc(sizeof(struct Entry));
00208         p_entry->country_code = country_code;
00209         p_entry->area_code = area_code;
00210         p_entry->number = number;
00211         p_entry->priority = priority;
00212 
00213         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00214 
00215         if ( rc ) {
00216                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00217                 ERR_LOG(logmsg);
00218                 sqlite3_close(db);
00219                 return -1;
00220         }
00221 
00222         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM %5$s ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, listname);
00223 
00224         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00225 
00226         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00227                 sprintf(logmsg, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00228                 ERR_LOG(logmsg);
00229                 sqlite3_close(db);
00230                 return -1;
00231         }
00232 
00233         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE ) {
00234                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00235                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00236                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt(pp_stmt, p_entry);
00237                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00238                                 switch (listflag) {
00239                                         case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00240                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"+%d %d %llu\" accepted successfully.", country_code, area_code, number);
00241                                                 break;
00242                                         case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00243                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"+%d %d %llu\" blocked successfully.", country_code, area_code, number);
00244                                                 break;
00245                                         default:
00246                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Something goes wrong...");
00247                                 }
00248                                 INFO_LOG(logmsg);
00249                                 break;
00250                         }
00251                 }
00252         }
00253 
00254 
00255         // Cleaning up
00256         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00257         sqlite3_close(db);
00258         free(p_entry);
00259 
00260         return found_flag;
00261 }
00262 
00263 int check_entry_string(char *number,
00264                        int priority,
00265                        int listflag)
00266 {
00267         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00268 
00269         sqlite3 *db;
00270         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00271         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00272         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00273         int rc;
00274         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00275         int found_flag = 0;
00276 
00277         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00278 
00279         if ( rc ) {
00280                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00281                 ERR_LOG(logmsg);
00282                 sqlite3_close(db);
00283                 return -1;
00284         }
00285 
00286         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM %5$s ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, listname);
00287 
00288         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00289 
00290         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00291                 sprintf(logmsg, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00292                 ERR_LOG(logmsg);
00293                 sqlite3_close(db);
00294                 return -1;
00295         }
00296 
00297         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE ) {
00298                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00299                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00300                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt_string(pp_stmt, number, priority);
00301                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00302                                 switch (listflag) {
00303                                         case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00304                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"%s\" accepted successfully.", number);
00305                                                 break;
00306                                         case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00307                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"%s\" blocked successfully.", number);
00308                                                 break;
00309                                         default:
00310                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Something goes wrong...");
00311                                 }
00312                                 INFO_LOG(logmsg);
00313                                 break;
00314                         }
00315                 }
00316         }
00317 
00318 
00319         // Cleaning up
00320         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00321         sqlite3_close(db);
00322 
00323         return found_flag;
00324 }

00326 int change_name(int country_code,
00327                 int area_code,
00328                 unsigned long long number,
00329                 char *new_name,
00330                 int listflag)
00331 {
00332         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00333 
00334         sqlite3 *db;
00335         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00336         char *errMsg = 0;
00337         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00338         int rc;
00339         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00340 
00341         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00342 
00343         if ( rc ) {
00344                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00345                 ERR_LOG(logmsg);
00346                 sqlite3_close(db);
00347                 return 0;
00348         }
00349 
00350         sprintf(stmt, "UPDATE %s SET %s = \"%s\" WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_NAME, new_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00351 
00352         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00353         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00354                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00355                 ERR_LOG(error);
00356                 sqlite3_close(db);
00357                 return 0;
00358         }
00359 
00360         sqlite3_close(db);
00361 
00362         return 1;
00363 }

00366                   int area_code,
00367                   unsigned long long number,
00368                   int new_country_code,
00369                   int new_area_code,
00370                   unsigned long long new_number,
00371                   int listflag)

00374 
00375         sqlite3 *db;
00376         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00377         char *errMsg = 0;
00378         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00379         int rc;
00380         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00381 
00382         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00383 
00384         if ( rc ) {
00385                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00386                 ERR_LOG(logmsg);
00387                 sqlite3_close(db);
00388                 return 0;
00389         }
00390 
00391         sprintf(stmt, "UPDATE %s SET %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_COUNTRYCODE, new_country_code, TB_AREACODE, new_area_code, TB_NUMBER, new_number, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00392 
00393         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00394         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00395                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00396                 ERR_LOG(error);
00397                 sqlite3_close(db);
00398                 return 0;
00399         }
00400 
00401         sqlite3_close(db);
00402 
00403         return 1;
00404 }

00445 int change_priority(int country_code,
